title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 25 November 2011 - XWiki
content:

08:40 <CIA-102> Eduard Moraru feature-applicationWithinMinutes \* rdfc1cfb / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-workspace/xwiki-platform-workspace-ui/src/main/resources/WorkspaceManager/Install.xml : Applied the workaround for issue XWIKI 7184 (#includeTopic does not work right if the included document is in syntax 2.0) to the workspace module. (+28 more commits...) - http://git.io/E0JgLg  
08:49 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:51 <+tmortagne> Hi guys  
08:51 <+tmortagne> looks like agent-5 and 6 have some issue  
08:51 <+tmortagne> WYSIWYG build constantly fail on agent-5 and I was unable to run integration tests on them yesterday  
08:52 <+tmortagne> i checked and xvnc was properly running but it was still unable to start FF  
08:52 <+tmortagne> as for the WYSIWYG Editor - WAR Distribution I don't understand exactly the error  
09:19 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:45 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:54 <vmassol> good morning everyone  
09:54 <CIA-102> Vincent Massol master \* rd588015 / (7 files in 3 dirs): XCOMMONS-62: Allow Event Listeners to have priorities - http://git.io/\_k3Ygg  
10:19 <CIA-102> tmortagne master \* r3c03a16 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-extension/xwiki-platform-extension-repositories/xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki/xwiki-platform-extension-repository-xwiki-server-ui/src/main/resources/ExtensionCode/ExtensionSheet.xml : XWIKI-7185: Standard installation not displayed anymore - http://git.io/2axELw

12:14 <+tmortagne>   p, li { white-space: pre-wrap; }  restarting xwiki.org for upgrade in about 10 minutes  
13:56 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
14:01 <CIA-102> tmortagne master \* rfdc98ae / (.project pom.xml): Update - http://git.io/fDRcJQ  
14:01 <CIA-102> tmortagne master \* rfbdc651 / src/main/webapp/WEB-INF/hibernate.mysql.cfg.xml.default : Update default - http://git.io/8UeG-A  
14:16 <+tmortagne> restarting xwiki.org again (new test)  
15:20 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
15:28 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
15:39 <+sburjan> Enygma`: In order to install Workspaces in my xwiki, do I need something else besides http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Workspace+Application ?  
15:41 <+Enygma`> sburjan: no, you should just follow the install process  
15:41 <+sburjan> okay,t hanks  
15:42 <+Enygma`> what version are you planning to test?  
15:43 <+sburjan> I guess 3.2 .. which is linked to the download button  
15:44 <+sburjan> I can use 3.3 M2 if you want  
15:45 <+Enygma`> well, I`m guessing you should test the latest  
15:45 <+Enygma`> let me update the page to point to the maven repository for download  
15:46 <+sburjan> I thought download links are automatically displayed .. it's gonna take a lot of time to manually update download links on each release  
15:49 <+sburjan> Enygma`: so I don't need to install Workspace Component and Workspace Plugin before importing workspaces UI ?  
15:50 <+Enygma`> download link updated  
15:50 <+Enygma`> you have the dependencies section for the Workspace Application  
15:50 <+Enygma`> dependencies usually have to be installed before installing anything else  
15:51 <+sburjan> ok, installing now  
15:51 <+Enygma`> maybe I should add a note to emphasize this  
15:51 <+sburjan> no, it's clearly stated in the Prerequisites section  
15:51 <+sburjan> too bag we don't have a meta package with everything you need. I guess EM will fix this  
15:51 <+Enygma`> actually... it says for each item that "You need to make sure that X is already installed before installing this application"  
15:51 <+Enygma`> so it should be fine  
15:52 <+Enygma`> yes... EM should take care of this in the future  
15:52 <+Enygma`> for now you just have to follow the yellow brick road :)  
16:00 <+sburjan> ok, something is fishy, I get a stack when starting the container  
16:00 <+sburjan> java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Failed to get fields for class [org.xwiki.workspace.internal.DefaultWorkspaceManager] because the class [com/xpn/xwiki/plugin/applicationmanager/core/plugin/XWikiPluginMessageTool] couldn't be found in the ClassLoader.  
16:01 <+sburjan> I have both jars in /lib  
16:06 <+Enygma`> you probably do not have the application manager plugin installed  
16:06 <+Enygma`> it's required by the wiki manager plugin  
16:11 <+sburjan> yes, true. so 3 jar dependency :)  
16:27 <+sburjan> ok, now I am unable to install it  
16:28 <+sburjan> template links from WorkspaceManager.Install points to http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-wiki/3.3-milestone-2/xwiki-enterprise-wiki-3.3-milestone-2.xar  
16:28 <+sburjan> wichc seems broken  
16:32 <+Enygma`> yep, due to recent changes in enterprise xar distribution  
16:32 <+Enygma`> the correct link is obviously nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public/org/xwiki/enterprise/xwiki-enterprise-ui-all/3.3-milestone-2/xwiki-enterprise-ui-all-3.3-milestone-2.xar  
16:33 <+sburjan> should I create a report so you can fix it ?>  
16:34 <+Enygma`> you can  
16:35 <+sburjan> ok. so 3 JAR's and 2 XAR's  
16:36 <+sburjan> Error installing workspace template. null  
16:36 <+sburjan> ok, creting an issue  
16:36 <+sburjan> \*creating  
16:39 <+sburjan> XWIKI-7187  
16:49 <CIA-102> Eduard Moraru master \* rcc715ae / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-workspace/xwiki-platform-workspace-ui/src/main/resources/WorkspaceManager/Install.xml : XWIKI-7187 : Unable to install Workspaces due to broken template link ...  
16:50 <+Enygma`> sburjan: you`ve attached the renamed XE xar to the WorkspaceManager.Install page and got the error?  
16:50 <+Enygma`> what about the stack trace?  
16:50 <+Enygma`> (console)  
16:51 <+sburjan> stacktrace because I forgot to put the 3rd jar in /libs  
16:52 <+Enygma`> no, I mean did you get any stack trace for the "Error installing workspace template. null" ?  
16:52 <+sburjan> nope  
16:53 <+Enygma`> what database are you using?  
16:53 <+sburjan> jetty + hsqldb .. zip version  
16:53 <+Enygma`> yes, that could be the problem  
16:53 <+Enygma`> Wiki Manager does not work with hsqldb AFAIK  
16:54 <+Enygma`> so you need to run it in mysql  
16:54 <+Enygma`> this should be in the Wiki Manager documentation  
16:54 <+sburjan> wel the db should be independent because we have hibernate  
16:55 <+Enygma`> yes, but afaik, hsqldb did not support creating multiple databases or somehting like that  
16:55 <+Enygma`> there is a jira  
16:55 <+sburjan> yes, it's mentioned in the documentation  
16:55 <+Enygma`> XWIKI-1740  
16:55 <+Enygma`> ok, so please start mysql and update the hibernate config  
16:56 <+Enygma`> and try again  
16:56 <+Enygma`> (and add the mysql connector jar to the lib)  
17:00 <+sburjan> Enygma`: so this means that XEM also doesn't support hsqldb, right ?  
17:00 <+Enygma`> yes  
17:36 <vmassol> cjdelisle: you there?  
17:39 <vmassol> guys I'm trying to understand why we call rollback() all the tie  
17:39 <vmassol> time  
17:40 <vmassol> for ex in XHS.search() we always end up calling endTransation(… false,....)  
17:40 <vmassol> and in endTransaction, false means we call rollback and not commit  
17:42 <vmassol> is it because it's a read method? If so why do we need to call rollback?  
17:45 <Denis> has quit  
17:51 <evalica> has quit  
18:00 <sburjan> has quit

23:24 <+Enygma`> sburjan`: did you manage to install and use workspaces?
